title: Installation issue: Visit
body:
The patch `spack-changes.patch` does not apply cleanly to older versions of visit (e.g. version `2.13.3`).

@sethrj I think you created this patch file in commit 4b400d503216cbc6b56f5f7231a9ed288d43fb96.  Should its application be limited to `visit@3.0.1`? Something like this?

```diff
    variant('python', default=True, description='Enable Python support')
    variant('mpi',    default=True, description='Enable parallel engine')

-    patch('spack-changes.patch')
+    patch('spack-changes.patch', when='@3.0:3.0.1')
    patch('nonframework-qwt.patch', when='^qt~framework platform=darwin')
    patch('parallel-hdf5.patch', when='+hdf5+mpi')


```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install visit@2.13.3 % gcc@9.2.0

==> Staging archive: /tmp/kellyt/spack-stage/spack-stage-visit-2.13.3-nfr7ef3zy3z7zf4olkj2mqcmcwg3wj2f/visit2.13.3.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /tmp/kellyt/spack-stage/spack-stage-visit-2.13.3-nfr7ef3zy3z7zf4olkj2mqcmcwg3wj2f
2 out of 2 hunks FAILED -- saving rejects to file src/CMakeLists.txt.rej
==> Patch /ccs/opt/vendors/spack-0.14.2/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/visit/spack-changes.patch failed.
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/usr/bin/patch' '-s' '-p' '1' '-i' '/ccs/opt/vendors/spack-0.14.2/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/visit/spack-changes.patch' '-d' '.'
==> Error: Failed to install visit due to ChildError: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
```

### Information on your system

```console
$ spack arch
linux-rhel7-sandybridge

$ cat /etc/redhat-release 
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 7.8 (Maipo)

$ cpuinfo | grep "model name" | sort -u
model name	: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-4620 0 @ 2.20GHz
```

I'm using spack version 0.14.2.

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [ ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [ ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
